programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer brings in an Olympic torch used in the relay for the 2002 Winter Games, an event held in Salt Lake City, Utah.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: The Wildfire Round is a ferocious battle to finish on time. In the Crossfire Round, it is a head-to-head potato showdown.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Armed with heavy digging equipment, Ricky and Marty Laguna target an area where a researcher claims the treasures of the Knights Templar could be buried.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The hunters return for another season, and one of them is determined to catch a famous reptile that lives deep in the swamp.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Mission Towing races to an urgent call on a logging road after a truck tumbles 90 feet into a creek, and Jamie Davis deploys air bags to flip a bulging tractor trailer in Alberta.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a 1920s car with wooden wheels and a ball and chain from Arizona's oldest prison.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is placed in a difficult position when a client offers him a set of Saddam Hussein's fingerprints, originally taken by the FBI.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Rhod Gilbert takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with writer, director and satirist Armando Iannucci and playwright Lucy Prebble joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Countdown presenter (and Apprentice sidekick) Nick Hewer squares off against his show's former maths whizz Carol Vorderman and comedian Rhod Gilbert, making the case with host Frank Skinner for their gripes and pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include train managers, camping, Facebook, golf, holidays and advertising slogans.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the quiz with a difference, with comedians Phill Jupitus, Josh Widdicombe and Sara Pascoe joining regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the topic of monsters.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: A baritone sells his soul to the devil to ensure his barbershop quartet wins a competition. Doc Brown reads this twisted tale, set in 1940s New York.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Gendle and Tim are dropped into a downhill bike park and create a human marble run using motorbikes and riders wearing zorbs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: More man-tastic DIY projects as brothers Kevin and Andrew Buckles engage in challenging and often quirky home improvement builds.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.sub-title: The Ultimate Boathouse Bed and Breakfast
programme.desc: More man-tastic DIY projects as brothers Kevin and Andrew Buckles engage in challenging and often quirky home improvement builds.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys go in search of a motorcycle that once belonged to Bonnie and Clyde.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse and Brandon argue, giving Scott and Chrissy a chance to jump in with their bid.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The bidders head to Marina del Rey, California, in search of nautical equipment.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The items Mike and Frank bought in Europe arrive in the US, and the guys also visit a vintage car company.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Highlights of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Best of Red Bull Soapbox: Vol 2
Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and the team take on their toughest challenge yet - keeping their tongues in check during a meeting with their counterparts from the German equivalent of the show. James May also test-drives a quirky Japanese car, and Richard Hammond puts a Mazda concept car through its paces. Jamiroquai frontman Jay Kay is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Actress Chizzy Akudolu, writer and actor Charlie Higson, historian Kate Williams and comedian Tom Allen take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents the comedy panel show, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Alex Jones, Chris Tarrant, Alexander Armstrong and Mel Giedroyc to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Rich Hall, Josie Lawrence and John Sessions join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Stephen Fry, providing interesting answers to questions on butterflies, blackberries and Bernards.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an episode originally shown in 2011, Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond find second-hand bargains for the same price as the Â£6,995 Nissan Pixo. James May is in Nevada to test the toughness of the Range Rover Evoque, driving it through Death Valley before chauffeuring a megastar across Las Vegas. Plus, the McLaren MP4-12C is compared with its supercar rival the Ferrari 458 Italia, and four-time Formula One world champion Sebastian Vettel is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Rhod Gilbert force-feeds Alex Horne a jug of mocha, Kerry Godliman hits a cricket ball with a croquet mallet, and Phil Wang makes a really strange noise.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Actress Chizzy Akudolu, writer and actor Charlie Higson, historian Kate Williams and comedian Tom Allen take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and musician Bill Bailey, actress Una Stubbs and radio presenter Alice Levine to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include taramasalata, people who talk too loudly and drama cliches.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Phil Kay, John Sessions and Clive Anderson for more interesting answers on subjects including bills, Bens and buildings in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Rhod Gilbert takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with writer, director and satirist Armando Iannucci and playwright Lucy Prebble joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner introduces a look back at some of the best bits from the series, plus a few hitherto unseen clips. Topics nominated for consignment to oblivion include dabbing, people who love the outdoors and The Archers.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Jessica Knappett piles shoes on some butcher's scales, James Acaster tries the emergency alarm on a lift, and Rhod Gilbert smears mustard in his eyes.

programme.title: Jon Richardson: Ultimate Worrier
programme.desc: Jon and guests Sara Pascoe, Phil Wang and Catherine Bohart discuss, categorise and rank worries to do with Global Affairs. Does the world hate Britain? What are micronations?.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with Radio 4's The News Quiz host Miles Jupp and journalist Quentin Letts joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring ship graveyards, including Scapa Flow in Orkney, where German warships were scuttled after the First World War, and Mallows Bay, home to 200 wrecks colonised by wildlife.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.sub-title: The Brides In The Bath Killer
programme.desc: The case of George Smith, who married a succession of women and murdered them so he could inherit their wealth.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: One of the largest Nazi bunkers ever constructed, outside the French town of Watten, a missile facility with storage for 108 missiles, a liquid oxygen factory and two launch pads.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two programmes from Walmer Castle in Kent, where the team values a jacket worn by President Kennedy that could be one of the most valuable items ever featured on the series. Other items brought in include an art deco mask that terrifies its owner's children, an enamel advertising sign, and a letter from Lord Nelson that has an unexpected connection to the owner's dead husband.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ghostly house in a tropical paradise that is still feared by the locals and a pioneering complex marked by both glory and tragedy that will soon to be lost forever.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second visit in this series to Plas Newydd on the Isle of Anglesey. The team examine rarities including a cabinet with a secret function, a magazine rack made by celebrated designer Piero Fornasetti, a collection of historical items related to deafness, a Chinese silver punchbowl and a photo that has a connection to the Apollo 11 mission.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring ship graveyards, including Scapa Flow in Orkney, where German warships were scuttled after the First World War, and Mallows Bay, home to 200 wrecks colonised by wildlife.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: The stories of two murderers in London and Berlin, who both took advantage of the Blackouts during the Second World War to commit their crimes undetected.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: David Jason: My Life on Screen
programme.desc: The actor looks back at his transition from supporting roles to leads, and the early days of Only Fools and Horses.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: When a government minister is killed by a fire in a London hotel, terrorists are suspected of starting the blaze _ until Leo discovers a wad of notes on the MP's bed. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan tries to uncover the truth, but finds her investigations are hampered by a former schoolfriend who claims to work for the Cabinet Office. Amanda Burton and William Gaminara star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Reg Hollis and Tony Stamp observe drugs being brought into Stonewall women's prison through the visitors' hall as corrupt officers turn a blind eye. Jo Masters realises Cath Wilson has used her to establish herself as top dog on the wing and sets out to get revenge. Yvonne Hemmingway is sorely tempted when her ex Nick pleads for a second chance. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Gregg's romance with Tiggy develops, and Blue Watch are called out to deal with a massive blaze at a used-car lot. Starring Steven Houghton.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads receive an emergency call while on jungle manoeuvres Down Under, and rush off to Hope Bay, the village adjacent to their camp, which has just been devastated by a cyclone. Taylor manfully puts affairs of the heart on hold to supervise rescue operations, but unfortunately, not everyone can be saved.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave and Donna's relationship is threatened, and Paddy Garvey and Nancy Thorpe make some important decisions. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Reg Hollis and Tony Stamp observe drugs being brought into Stonewall women's prison through the visitors' hall as corrupt officers turn a blind eye. Jo Masters realises Cath Wilson has used her to establish herself as top dog on the wing and sets out to get revenge. Yvonne Hemmingway is sorely tempted when her ex Nick pleads for a second chance. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Mark and Tricia's anticipation of their honeymoon is ruined when a furious Chrissie discovers her mother's cancer has returned and demands to know why she was not told. Sam gets emotionally involved in the case of a teenage girl with hepatitis C whose parents seem to know little about her medical history, and Matt struggles to fight his growing attraction to patient Nikki.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max risks his reputation by going too far in his treatment of a drug addict on an eventful New Year's Eve, while Barney and Spencer are forced to put aside their differences long enough to rescue a patient from a life-threatening situation. Holly receives a shock in the form of a mystery birthday card from Patrick's secret admirer. Drama with the staff of Holby's accident and emergency department, starring Robert Gwilym, Ronnie McCann and Ben Keaton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zain Nadir finds a witness to the Garrison shooting, but inept interference from DI Markham scuppers the case and puts Dale Smith in grave danger as he searches for the gun at Larson's home. Amber Johannsen rumbles Dan's affair with drug referral officer Rochelle Barratt and is warned in no uncertain terms to keep her mouth shut.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel sets about looking for a job. David is pleased to receive a visit from the police, and the financial noose tightens around Frank's neck.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil is under pressure to keep his promise to burn down Frank's Autos, but Frank's plans don't go according to plan.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A car crash leads to an unusual rescue for the squad. Meanwhile, Nick gets a surprise when he returns home. Starring Andrew Kazamia.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack's mountain rescue skills are put to the test when a kidney transplant patient is lost during a storm. Back at the practice, Will tries to deal with his personal problems. Kevin Whately, Amanda Burton and Simon Shepherd star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Denise Van Outen joins the cast as new district nurse Kim, a single parent with a shady past who doesn't take kindly to anyone prying into her affairs. Beth begins to have second thoughts as she and Tom prepare to leave the village, especially when friend Hattie reveals she has terminal cancer, and Ozias Harding takes up the reins at the factory once more. Prunella Scales guest stars.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey decides to make an effort with her in-laws for Darryl's sake - but soon lives to regret it. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy. The death of her husband leaves upper-class snob Audrey fforbes-Hamilton a widow in drastically reduced circumstances, with her beloved ancestral pile up for auction. Starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour vows that the days of Edie having to carry a dustbin are over, and promises to install a waste disposal unit for her. Meanwhile, a former wartime comrade of Wally's makes an appearance. Michael Aldridge, Thora Hird and Joe Gladwin star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Having witnessed his sister Edie fail several driving tests, Seymour gallantly volunteers to help teach her. However, because he is unable to control a vehicle himself, he needs a qualified motorist to ride along. Michael Aldridge and Thora Hird star.

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Celebrity portrait painter Agatha Troy asks Alleyn to investigate the death of a venerable Shakespearean actor whose portrait she had been commissioned to paint. Drama, starring Patrick Malahide, with Belinda Lang.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sasha is forced to work with her ex-husband Ned Hancock when their teams investigate the death of film critic Oliver Houghton, whose body was discovered floating in the Thames. UCOS delves into the victim's past and explores his link to the murder of a conceptual artist 20 years previously, while Hancock's knowledge of London's hidden past proves invaluable when a piece of occult footage from the 1970s plunges the investigators into the macabre world of human sacrifice. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star, with a guest appearance by Barnaby Kay.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is asked to help the police investigate the case of two brothers found dead in a police cell - but subsequent developments force her to confront the unpalatable truth about her involvement in a murder inquiry 13 years previously.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Freeze Out
programme.desc: Game show of skill and quizzing ability in which contestants compete at a giant circular ice table for the chance to manoeuvre gliding sliders on a large game board, hoping to eventually secure a jackpot of Â£10,000. Hosted by Mark Durden-Smith, with former Premier League referee Uriah Rennie.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The latest on the coronavirus pandemic with Lorraine Kelly, including medical advice from Dr Hilary Jones and stories of how people are coping with the lockdown.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five London firefighters answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Becca, Don, Janet and Ronnie pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. A birthday cake sets a house on fire, a toddler puts an iPad in a washing machine and a cow breaks into a home to use the swimming pool.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: John Barnes and Matt Le Tissier were both flying the flag for England in the recent ITV show Harry's Heroes - but now they're on different sides as they take part in the knockout quiz, captaining teams comprising members of their own families in a bid to make it through to the next round. At stake for the eventual winners is Â£25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. The Chase star Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty is the one asking the questions for once.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show: Live
programme.desc: As life in lockdown continues, the financial journalist presents more advice for people who have found themselves living with financial uncertainty. Martin answers viewers' questions on how the economic crisis affects family finances, jobs and consumer rights.

programme.title: Unbelievable Moments Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents a selection of extraordinary eyewitness footage filmed by members of the public, including the heart-stopping story of a man who took a âpleasure flight' on a hang-glider. Two passengers on board the Viking Sky cruise ship that suffered engine failure in rough seas just off the coast of Norway recount how they were left fearing for their lives, while a heroic cop throws the rulebook out of the window when trying to save a baby's life on the roadside.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.sub-title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories: Alesha Dixon
programme.desc: The singer and Britain's Got Talent judge chats about her career and personal life, opening up to Piers about how, after finding fame with Mis-Teeq and as a solo artist, she lost her record contract and found out her husband was having an affair, all in the space of a few weeks. She speaks about being on the receiving end of a backlash after replacing Arlene Phillips on Strictly Come Dancing, and reveals how she juggles motherhood with songwriting and her TV work.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they catch the world's largest lobsters? How do they build the iconic chesterfield sofa? And, how do they capture the world's sharpest TV pictures?.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: In the West Country, Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove discover sheds full of classic bikes, vintage cars and extraordinary limousines, including one owned by Eva Peron, one-time wife of the Argentine President Juan Peron.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove visit a fanatical biker in Yorkshire, who has the biggest collection of motorcycles they've seen so far.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Unrelenting winds rip across the crab grounds, and the crew of the Wizard prepares to do battle with the descending polar ice pack. Meanwhile, tempers flare on board the Kodiak.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: It's the end of the mining season and the last chance for the teams. The Rookies gamble their hopes on one last haul of opal and the Opal Queen makes a final desperate dig.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: Gary is in Bingley, West Yorkshire, to tear down an old police station without destroying the entire building. And, a man turns scrap metal into sculptures..

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer lands a Ford Escort Mk1 for Â£4,500 in an internet auction, and he and Edd China get to work on giving the classic 1970s car a new lease of life with a retro refit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini checks out a a 1927 Rolls-Royce Phantom I Kenilworth and a 1930 Rolls-Royce Phantom I Newmarket.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini flies to Georgia for the sale of a muscle car collection and is determined to buy the red Dino GTS he covets.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: An insight into the design and production of the Chevy Camaro, which was introduced to the world in 1966, and has now reached its sixth generation.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: It's the end of the mining season and the last chance for the teams. The Rookies gamble their hopes on one last haul of opal and the Opal Queen makes a final desperate dig.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The captains battle the polar ice pack in a losing bid to save their pots, and the Northwestern and Wizard struggle to escape St Paul harbour.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk expert Frank Fritz falls hard for a Harley Davidson 'knucklehead' at a collector's hidden California compound.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John enjoy a tour of the Midlands. In Walsall, they have a money-spinning idea, in Birmingham Drew finds treasure and they also explore a grand country house.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Grimsby, the team members have their work cut out when demolishing a pigeon-infested shopping centre. Later, in Norfolk, a sculptor takes scrap metal from a farm.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer searches for a BMW M3 E36 that Edd China can restore to make a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China goes over budget to restore a BMW M3 E36, making it more difficult for Mike Brewer to achieve a profit when he sells it on.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New team the Bushmen clash with opal thieves raiding one of their mines. The Cookes hack an old digging machine, while the Fire Crew hunt for a new deposit of rare black opal.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard haggles with a dealer at an Elizabethan manor house, is blown away by a jet engine in a Welsh museum and meets an old friend in Sheffield.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds one of only 1,000 Mini Cooper S MC40s ever made, the 40th anniversary homage to the Monte Carlo rally-winning British icon.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne travels to Georgia, where he uncovers an ultra-rare, completely original 1921 Stutz Bearcat that has sat garaged for a staggering 85 years.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Cameras head underground into America's largest mine to find out how lead is extracted. Plus, how made-to-measure shotguns are manufactured.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technological processes involved in manufacturing peanut butter, and how domestic appliances are tested.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Jensen Interceptor, but his Â£5,000 budget restricts him to poor examples of the car, leaving mechanic Edd China with plenty of work to do.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The difficulties faced by forensic scientists and police in catching bombers and snipers, who often have no connection to their victims.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In February 2008, Christopher Duncan left his apartment in San Antonio, Texas, and disappeared. Police had little to go on until surveillance footage offered the potential to reveal the identity of a dangerous killer.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which a 21-year-old mother failed to return from night classes, before her car was found burned out. Investigators immediately suspected foul play, but no one was prepared for the web of lies that unravelled following her disappearance.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI manhunt launched in 1999 for Rafael Resendez-Ramirez, a Mexican migrant worker who killed his victims close to railway tracks.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators intervene to save 30 hungry horses in one of the biggest and most challenging rescues ever for the team.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown visits Beijing and treats his first hamster, is stunned to have to tend to some pet snails, and has an unforgettable encounter with giant pandas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A woman wants fur muffs but her maid of honour is not keen. Meanwhile, a bride's friend refuses to be a maid unless she gets the dress she wants.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Country girl Elizabeth admits she is more comfortable with hunting than dress shopping, while Christina's father does not respond well to a photo of his daughter in her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Self-conscious Katie wonders whether her dream dress will fit, while Ivy's fiance insists she try on a gown that is four times her budget.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three contestants scour a market in SÃ¨te on France's Mediterranean coast, with a wardrobe and a death mask among the items they upcycle in the hope of making a profit.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Managing director James heads to Lanzarote to tackle his biggest deal yet - the sale of a Â£1.5million yellow submarine. A jeweller to the stars wants to pawn her collection to expand her business, while Lawrence appraises a guitar with links to punk band the Sex Pistols owned by a former millionaire who's now living in a bedsit. A doting father-to-be decides to get rid of his pride-and-joy black Ferrari to buy a family home.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A dog arrives at the shelter after being attacked by another animal and left without veterinary treatment.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Vet Rachel Lee is determined to save an injured dog that has a deep wound on its neck.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police link the disappearance of a motel worker to a trail of blood, but although they believe they have found the perpetrator, they struggle to locate the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How murder investigation experts reconstruct crimes from the remains of burnt evidence when the body of the victim has yet to be identified.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Idaho roofer and avid hunter Jeramy Burt, who vanished in February 2007 shortly after telling his ex-wife he intended to seek a new life. Several months later, his car was found torched in a remote desert, but he had taken no other personal items with him other than his mobile phone.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Summer and Joseph McStay, who vanished from their home San Diego, California, with their two children in February 2010, leaving their pets and possessions behind. It transpired the pair were being chased by various debt collection agents and CCTV footage suggested they had crossed into Mexico. Subsequent to this documentary's first airing, their bodies were recovered from a shallow grave in the Californian desert, though the identity of their killers remains unknown.

programme.title: True Crime with Aphrodite Jones
programme.desc: The murder of Elizabeth Begaren, shot dead after her car was run off California's Route 91 in January 1998. The case went cold for 15 years until her husband Nuzzio was convicted of soliciting Los Angeles gang member Guillermo Espinoza to commit the act in order to access the proceeds of an insurance policy.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dawn searches for a princess gown for her wedding, but cannot find anything that lives up to her standards.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Three brides, whose weddings are a celebration of life as well as love. Cheryl and Krisin have recently beaten cancer, and Jennifer is battling kidney disease.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tanya takes her family with her to find a blush-coloured dress, but when they prove brutally honest in their opinions, it is left to the assistant to keep the peace.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Katie wants a mermaid-style dress, but her mother would prefer to see her in a traditional ballgown. Consultant Jenny is left trying to find a compromise.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Broadway star Kristin Chenoweth helps her best friend to find a dress with glitz and glam, while two sets of sisters fail to agree on a style.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Saralyn is in need of two dresses to share her wedding with her sister, and Rachel brings her sibling to help her make a decision.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: I Should've Fought Harder to Keep Her
programme.desc: Ouida searches for the child that her family forced her to place for adoption. Jon seeks to connect with the daughter he regrets losing. Hosted by Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Christina has lost more weight than she should have, which now threatens her life. Paula undergoes surgery to remove excess skin from her body.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: A study of Albert DeSalvo, dubbed the 'Boston Strangler'. He admitted to 13 murders, but some people believe his confession was false.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: In 1979, two young boys came home from school to find their mother's dead body in the living room. Investigators set out to track down the killer with no firm leads.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Agents and members of the public become involved in the search for an eight-year-old girl who has been abducted.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The role of DNA and ballistics reports in helping to solve the murder of a Swedish man whose body was found in a wood.
